page.title: 01PART OF NORTH FYLDE FARMING
page.content: A view of the North Fylde area taken from the A6, principle road north of Catterall, showing the landcover of the whole district through which the River Wyre flows from the hills to its mouth at the port of Fleetwood. An agricultural dairying and intensive grazing area of stock rearing, beef, sheep and pigs. The cultivated land cropped by wheat and barley, perhaps 5% of the whole. Industry is mainly related to agriculture. A large cement manufacturing works has a garden centre attached. The large modern water treatment plant of the northwest water authority recently commissioned by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth, servces an extensive area of Lancashire. Two firms manufacture prefabricated vehicle bodies. A small industrial complex has developed representing several light industrial
